title: Energy Medicine Degree and Training Program Information
description: Individuals searching for <u> Energy Medicine Degree and Training Program Information </u> found the articles, information, and resources on this page helpful.
cleaned_text: Essential Information Although there aren't any certificate programs specifically for energy medicine, many are available for specific kinds, such as qigong, Reiki and healing touch, to alternative medicine and health care professionals. Qigong students learn the meditation and energy cultivation techniques of the approach through modules and self-experiment. Those who pass the exit exam will be certified instructors. If a prospective enrollee doesn't have any prior education in traditional Chinese medicine, they may have to take a medicinal theory seminar before entrance. Reiki focuses on the transference of spiritual energy from one force to another. Students learn about traditional and transformational methods, positive energy utilization and elemental awareness. Healing touch therapy introduces pupils to the human energy system and how to manipulate energy to relieve pain and stress. Qigong Certificate Qigong curriculum explores meditation, massage and practices, as they apply to healing and treatment. Common class topics include: - Mysticism and medicine - Spirit medicine - The I-Ching - Medical qigong Reiki Certificate Within this program, students learn how to change their mental, physical and spiritual energy through Reiki practices. Some discussed healing techniques are: - Kundalini Reiki - Usui Reiki - Reiki symbolism - Reiki guides - Reiki sound Healing Touch Certificate Typical subjects covered in a healing touch program are: - Energy systems - Chakras - Meditation - Principles of healing touch - Intervention techniques Popular Careers Graduates are qualified for employment in a variety of settings, including spas, yoga studios and gyms. Reiki students who seek a degree are eligible to work in hospitals, mental health and elder care facilities. Employment Outlook and Salary Information According to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), employment for massage therapists is predicted to grow at a rate of 21% from 2019-2029 with a median annual salary of $43,620 as of May 2020 (www.bls.gov). Continuing Education Graduates can further their education by pursuing a master's degree or a certificate in Complementary and [Alternative Medicine](https://bestaccreditedcolleges.org/articles/alternative-medicine-career.html) (CAM) to learn Western biomedicine principles. Alternative medicine and health care professionals interested in incorporating energy medicine into their practice may seek enrollment in a qigong, Reiki or healing touch certificate program. Graduates can find work in medical facilities as well as health and fitness establishments.
